info.title: Merge Accounting API
info.description: The unified API for building rich integrations with multiple Accounting & Finance platforms.

get.description: Get details for a linked account.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Gets a list of audit trail events.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred before this time

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: If included, will only include events with the given event type. Possible values include: `CREATED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `DELETED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `CREATED_TEST_API_KEY`, `DELETED_TEST_API_KEY`, `REGENERATED_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `INVITED_USER`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_ENABLED`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_DISABLED`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_DESTINATION`, `DELETED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_SCOPES`, `CHANGED_PERSONAL_INFORMATION`, `CHANGED_ORGANIZATION_SETTINGS`, `ENABLED_INTEGRATION`, `DISABLED_INTEGRATION`, `ENABLED_CATEGORY`, `DISABLED_CATEGORY`, `CHANGED_PASSWORD`, `RESET_PASSWORD`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `FORCED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_RESYNC`, `MUTED_ISSUE`, `GENERATED_MAGIC_LINK`, `ENABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `DISABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `MERGE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_CHANGED`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred after this time

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: If provided, this will return events associated with the specified user email. Please note that the email address reflects the user's email at the time of the event, and may not be their current email.

get.description: Get all Field Mappings for this Linked Account. Field Mappings are mappings between third-party Remote Fields and user defined Merge fields. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/supplemental-data/field-mappings/overview/).

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

post.description: Create new Field Mappings that will be available after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

patch.description: Create or update existing Field Mappings for a Linked Account. Changes will be reflected after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

delete.description: Deletes Field Mappings for a Linked Account. All data related to this Field Mapping will be deleted and these changes will be reflected after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

Account.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a companys ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

AccountDetailsAndActions.description:
# The LinkedAccount Object
### Description
The `LinkedAccount` object is used to represent an end user's link with a specific integration.

### Usage Example
View a list of your organization's `LinkedAccount` objects.

subdomain.description: The tenant or domain the customer has provided access to.

is_duplicate.description: Whether a Production Linked Account's credentials match another existing Production Linked Account. This field is `null` for Test Linked Accounts, incomplete Production Linked Accounts, and ignored duplicate Production Linked Account sets.

AccountRequest.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
An `Account` represents a category in a companys ledger in which a financial transaction is recorded against. The aggregation of each `Account` object is often referred to as the **Chart of Accounts**.

An `Account` can be classified into one of the following categories, determined through the `classification` field:
* __Asset:__ Accounts Receivable and Bank Accounts
* __Liability:__ Accounts Payable and Credit Card Accounts
* __Equity:__ Treasury Accounts and Retained Earnings
* __Revenue:__ Income and Other Income
* __Expense:__ Cost of Goods Sold and Office Expenses

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Accounts` endpoint and view a company's accounts.

classification.description:
The account's broadest grouping.

* `ASSET` - ASSET
* `EQUITY` - EQUITY
* `EXPENSE` - EXPENSE
* `LIABILITY` - LIABILITY
* `REVENUE` - REVENUE

AccountingAttachment.description:
# The Accounting Attachment Object
### Description
The `AccountingAttachment` object is used to represent a company's attachments.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST AccountingAttachments` endpoint and view a company's attachments.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the accounting attachment belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

AccountingPeriod.description:
# The AccountingPeriod Object
### Description
The `AccountingPeriod` object is used to define a period of time in which events occurred.

### Usage Example
Common models like `Invoice` and `Transaction` will have `AccountingPeriod` objects which will denote when they occurred.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

user_name.description: The User's full name at the time of this Event occurring.

user_email.description: The User's email at the time of this Event occurring.

role.description:
Designates the role of the user (or SYSTEM/API if action not taken by a user) at the time of this Event occurring.

* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

AvailableActions.description:
# The AvailableActions Object
### Description
The `Activity` object is used to see all available model/operation combinations for an integration.

### Usage Example
Fetch all the actions available for the `Zenefits` integration.

BalanceSheet.description:
# The BalanceSheet Object
### Description
The `BalanceSheet` object shows a companys assets, liabilities, and equity. Assets should be equal to liability and equity combined. This shows the companys financial health at a specific point in time.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST BalanceSheets` endpoint and view a company's balance sheets.

company.description: `Company` object for the given `BalanceSheet` object.

date.description: The balance sheet's date. The balance sheet data will reflect the company's financial position this point in time.

remote_generated_at.description: The time that balance sheet was generated by the accounting system.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

CashFlowStatement.description:
# The CashFlowStatement Object
### Description
The `CashFlowStatement` object shows operating activities, investing activities, and financing activities over a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CashFlowStatements` endpoint and view a company's cash flow statements.

CompanyInfo.description:
# The CompanyInfo Object
### Description
The `CompanyInfo` object contains information about the company of the linked account. If the company has multiple entities (also known as subsidiaries), each entity may show up as a single `CompanyInfo` record.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET CompanyInfo` endpoint and view a company's information.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

Contact.description:
# The Contact Object
### Description
A `Contact` is an individual or business entity to which products and services are sold to or purchased from. The `Contact` model contains both Customers, in which products and services are sold to, and Vendors (or Suppliers), in which products and services are purchased from.
* A `Contact` is a Vendor/Supplier if the `is_supplier` property is true.
* A `Contact` is a customer if the `is_customer` property is true.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Contacts` endpoint and view a company's contacts.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

is_supplier.description: Whether the contact is a supplier.

is_customer.description: Whether the contact is a customer.

currency.description: The currency the contact's transactions are in.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's contact was updated.

company.description: The company the contact belongs to.

addresses.description: `Address` object IDs for the given `Contacts` object.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

CreditNote.description:
# The CreditNote Object
### Description
A `CreditNote` is transaction issued to a customer, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed by the customer. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a sales transaction. A `CreditNote` can be applied to *Accounts Receivable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST CreditNotes` endpoint and view a company's credit notes.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The credit note's status.

* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's credit note was created.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

DataPassthroughRequest.description:
# The DataPassthrough Object
### Description
The `DataPassthrough` object is used to send information to an otherwise-unsupported third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
Create a `DataPassthrough` to get team hierarchies from your Rippling integration.

path.description: The path of the request in the third party's platform.

base_url_override.description: An optional override of the third party's base url for the request.

data.description: The data with the request. You must include a `request_format` parameter matching the data's format

multipart_form_data.description: Pass an array of `MultipartFormField` objects in here instead of using the `data` param if `request_format` is set to `MULTIPART`.

headers.description: The headers to use for the request (Merge will handle the account's authorization headers). `Content-Type` header is required for passthrough. Choose content type corresponding to expected format of receiving server.

normalize_response.description: Optional. If true, the response will always be an object of the form `{"type": T, "value": ...}` where `T` will be one of `string, boolean, number, null, array, object`.

end_user_email_address.description: Your end user's email address. This is purely for identification purposes - setting this value will not cause any emails to be sent.

end_user_origin_id.description: This unique identifier typically represents the ID for your end user in your product's database. This value must be distinct from other Linked Accounts' unique identifiers.

categories.description: The integration categories to show in Merge Link.

integration.description: The slug of a specific pre-selected integration for this linking flow token. For examples of slugs, see https://docs.merge.dev/guides/merge-link/single-integration/.

link_expiry_mins.description: An integer number of minutes between [30, 720 or 10080 if for a Magic Link URL] for how long this token is valid. Defaults to 30.

should_create_magic_link_url.description: Whether to generate a Magic Link URL. Defaults to false. For more information on Magic Link, see https://merge.dev/blog/integrations-fast-say-hello-to-magic-link.

common_models.description: An array of objects to specify the models and fields that will be disabled for a given Linked Account. Each object uses model_id, enabled_actions, and disabled_fields to specify the model, method, and fields that are scoped for a given Linked Account.

category_common_model_scopes.description: When creating a Link Token, you can set permissions for Common Models that will apply to the account that is going to be linked. Any model or field not specified in link token payload will default to existing settings.

language.description: The language code for the language to localize Merge Link to.

integration_specific_config.description: A JSON object containing integration-specific configuration options.

detail.example: custom_fields is a required field on model.

Expense.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

ExpenseLineRequest.description:
# The ExpenseLine Object
### Description
The `ExpenseLine` object is used to represent an expense's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view the expense's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

ExpenseRequest.description:
# The Expense Object
### Description
The `Expense` object is used to represent a direct purchase by a business, typically made with a check, credit card, or cash. Each `Expense` object is dedicated to a grouping of expenses, with each expense recorded in the lines object.

The `Expense` object is used also used to represent refunds to direct purchases. Refunds can be distinguished from purchases by the amount sign of the records. Expense objects with a negative amount are purchases and `Expense` objects with a positive amount are refunds to those purchases.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Expense` endpoint and view a company's expense.

sub_total.description: The expense's total amount before tax.

GenerateRemoteKeyRequest.description:
# The GenerateRemoteKey Object
### Description
The `GenerateRemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to create a new remote key.

name.description: The name of the remote key

IncomeStatement.description:
# The IncomeStatement Object
### Description
The `IncomeStatement` object is used to represent a companys income, the cost of sales, operating expenses, and other non-operating expenses. The object also includes other important values like gross profit, gross operating profit, and net income. This represents a period of time (month, quarter, or year).

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET IncomeStatement` endpoint and view a company's income statement for a given period.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

Invoice.description:
# The Invoice Object
### Description
The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

sub_total.description: The total amount being paid before taxes.

status.description:

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED

* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `VOID` - VOID

total_tax_amount.description: The total amount being paid in taxes.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's invoice entry was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

accounting_period.description: The accounting period that the Invoice was generated in.

InvoiceLineItem.description:
# The InvoiceLineItem Object
### Description
The `InvoiceLineItem` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Invoice` endpoint and view the invoice's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

InvoiceRequest.description:
# The Invoice Object
    ### Description
    The `Invoice` object represents an itemized record of goods and/or services sold to a customer.
If type = accounts_payable `Invoice` is a bill, if type = accounts_receivable it's an invoice.

    ### Usage Example
    Fetch from the `LIST Invoices` endpoint and view a company's invoices.

type.description:
Whether the invoice is an accounts receivable or accounts payable. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE`, the invoice is a bill. If `type` is `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE`, it is an invoice.

* `ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE` - ACCOUNTS_RECEIVABLE
* `ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE` - ACCOUNTS_PAYABLE

status.description:
The status of the invoice.

* `PAID` - PAID
* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `PARTIALLY_PAID` - PARTIALLY_PAID
* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `VOID` - VOID

company.description: The company the invoice belongs to.

currency.description:

Item.description:
# The Item Object
### Description
The `Item` object refers to the goods involved in a transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST Items` endpoint and view a company's items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

purchase_price.description: The price at which the item is purchased from a vendor.

purchase_account.description: References the default account used to record a purchase of the item.

sales_account.description: References the default account used to record a sale.

company.description: The company the item belongs to.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's item note was updated.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

JournalEntry.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
A `JournalEntry` is a record of a transaction or event that is entered into a company's accounting system.

The `JournalEntry` common model contains records that are automatically created as a result of a certain type of transaction, like an Invoice, and records that are manually created against a companys ledger.

The lines of a given `JournalEntry` object should always sum to 0. A positive `net_amount` means the line represents a debit and a negative net_amount represents a credit.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was created.

remote_updated_at.description: When the third party's journal entry was updated.

applied_payments.description: A list of the Payment Applied to Lines common models related to a given Invoice, Credit Note, or Journal Entry.

JournalEntryRequest.description:
# The JournalEntry Object
### Description
The `JournalEntry` object is used to get a record of all manually created entries made in a companys general ledger. The journal line items for each journal entry should sum to zero.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view a company's journey entry.

JournalLine.description:
# The JournalLine Object
### Description
The `JournalLine` object is used to represent a journal entry's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET JournalEntry` endpoint and view the journal entry's line items.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The value of the line item including taxes and other fees.

ModelOperation.description:
# The ModelOperation Object
### Description
The `ModelOperation` object is used to represent the operations that are currently supported for a given model.

### Usage Example
View what operations are supported for the `Candidate` endpoint.

MultipartFormFieldRequest.description:
# The MultipartFormField Object
### Description
The `MultipartFormField` object is used to represent fields in an HTTP request using `multipart/form-data`.

### Usage Example
Create a `MultipartFormField` to define a multipart form entry.

name.description: The name of the form field

data.description: The data for the form field.

encoding.description:
The encoding of the value of `data`. Defaults to `RAW` if not defined.

* `RAW` - RAW
* `BASE64` - BASE64
* `GZIP_BASE64` - GZIP_BASE64

file_name.description: The file name of the form field, if the field is for a file.

content_type.description: The MIME type of the file, if the field is for a file.

remote_field_traversal_path.description: The field traversal path of the remote field listed when you hit the GET /remote-fields endpoint.

remote_method.description: The method of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

remote_url_path.description: The path of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

PatchedPaymentRequest.description:

The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

PaymentLineItem.description:
# The PaymentLineItem Object
### Description
The `PaymentLineItem` object is an applied-to-line on a `Payment` that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

### Usage Example
`Payment` will have a field called `applied-to-lines` which will be an array of `PaymentLineItemInternalMappingSerializer` objects that can either be a `Invoice`, `CreditNote`, or `JournalEntry`.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

applied_amount.description: The amount being applied to the transaction.

applied_date.description: The date the payment portion is applied.

related_object_id.description: The Merge ID of the transaction the payment portion is being applied to.

related_object_type.description: The type of transaction the payment portion is being applied to. Possible values include: INVOICE, JOURNAL_ENTRY, or CREDIT_NOTE.

PaymentRequest.description:
# The Payment Object
### Description
The `Payment` object represents general payments made towards a specific transaction.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Payment` endpoint and view an invoice's payment.

PurchaseOrder.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
A `PurchaseOrder` represents a request to purchase goods or services from a vendor. It outlines the details of the purchase, such as the items or services requested, quantities, prices, and delivery details.

A `PurchaseOrder` is a crucial component of the procurement process, but does not typically result in any impact on the companys general ledger. The general ledger is typically only affected when the `PurchaseOrder` is fulfilled as an *Accounts Payable* Invoice object.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

purchase_order_number.description: The human-readable number of the purchase order.

customer.description: The contact making the purchase order.

vendor.description: The party fulfilling the purchase order.

memo.description: A memo attached to the purchase order.

company.description: The company the purchase order belongs to.

currency.description:
The purchase order's currency.

PurchaseOrderLineItem.description:
# The PurchaseOrderLineItem Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrderLineItem` object is used to represent a purchase order's line item.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET PurchaseOrder` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.description: A description of the good being purchased.

account.description: The purchase order line item's account.

tracking_category.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking category.

tracking_categories.description: The purchase order line item's associated tracking categories.

tax_amount.description: The purchase order line item's tax amount.

total_line_amount.description: The purchase order line item's total amount.

currency.description:

PurchaseOrderRequest.description:
# The PurchaseOrder Object
### Description
The `PurchaseOrder` object is a record of request for a product or service between a buyer and seller.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST PurchaseOrders` endpoint and view a company's purchase orders.

status.description:
The purchase order's status.

* `DRAFT` - DRAFT
* `SUBMITTED` - SUBMITTED
* `AUTHORIZED` - AUTHORIZED
* `BILLED` - BILLED
* `DELETED` - DELETED

customer.description: The contact making the purchase order.

vendor.description: The party fulfilling the purchase order.

memo.description: A memo attached to the purchase order.

company.description: The company the purchase order belongs to.

currency.description:
The purchase order's currency.

RemoteKey.description:
# The RemoteKey Object
### Description
The `RemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to receive a new `RemoteKey`.

RemoteKeyForRegenerationRequest.description:
# The RemoteKeyForRegeneration Object
### Description
The `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` object is used to exchange an old remote key for a new one

### Usage Example
Post a `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` to swap out an old remote key for a new one

name.description: The name of the remote key

RemoteResponse.description:
# The RemoteResponse Object
### Description
The `RemoteResponse` object is used to represent information returned from a third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
View the `RemoteResponse` returned from your `DataPassthrough`.

ReportItem.description:
# The ReportItem Object
### Description
The `ReportItem` object is used to represent a report item for a Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement or Profit and Loss Report.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET BalanceSheet` endpoint and view the balance sheet's report items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

company.description: The company the report item belongs to.

RoleEnum.description:
* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

SyncStatus.description:
# The SyncStatus Object
### Description
The `SyncStatus` object is used to represent the syncing state of an account

### Usage Example
View the `SyncStatus` for an account to see how recently its models were synced.

SyncStatusStatusEnum.description:
* `SYNCING` - SYNCING
* `DONE` - DONE
* `FAILED` - FAILED
* `DISABLED` - DISABLED
* `PAUSED` - PAUSED
* `PARTIALLY_SYNCED` - PARTIALLY_SYNCED

TaxRate.description:
# The TaxRate Object
### Description
The `TaxRate` object is used to represent a tax rate.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `LIST TaxRates` endpoint and view tax rates relevant to a company.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

total_tax_rate.description: The taxs total tax rate - sum of the tax components (not compounded).

effective_tax_rate.description: The tax rates effective tax rate - total amount of tax with compounding.

company.description: The subsidiary that the tax rate belongs to (in the case of multi-entity systems).

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

TrackingCategory.description:
# The TrackingCategory Object
### Description
A `TrackingCategory` object represents a categorization method used to classify transactions within an accounting platform. They are often used to group records for reporting and analysis purposes. The most common types of `TrackingCategories` are Classes and Departments.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TrackingCategory` endpoint and view a company's tracking category.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

status.description:
The tracking category's status.

* `ACTIVE` - ACTIVE
* `ARCHIVED` - ARCHIVED

category_type.description:
The tracking categorys type.

* `CLASS` - CLASS
* `DEPARTMENT` - DEPARTMENT

parent_category.description: ID of the parent tracking category.

company.description: The company the tracking category belongs to.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

Transaction.description:
# The Transaction Object
### Description
The `Transaction` common model includes records of all types of transactions that do not appear in other common models. The type of transaction can be identified through the type field. More specifically, it will contain all types of transactions outside of:
* __Credit Notes__
* __Expenses__
* __Invoices__
* __Journal Entries__
* __Payments__
* __Purchase Orders__
* __Vendor Credits__

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET Transaction` endpoint and view a company's transactions.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

transaction_type.description: The type of transaction, which can by any transaction object not already included in Merges common model.

number.description: The transaction's number used for identifying purposes.

transaction_date.description: The date upon which the transaction occurred.

contact.description: The contact to whom the transaction relates to.

total_amount.description: The total amount being paid after taxes.

currency.description:
The transaction's currency.

TransactionLineItem.description:
# The TransactionLineItem Object
### Description
The `TransactionLineItem` object is used to represent a transaction's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET TransactionLineItem` endpoint and view the transaction's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

VendorCredit.description:
# The VendorCredit Object
### Description
A `VendorCredit` is transaction issued by a vendor to the accounting company, indicating a reduction or cancellation of the amount owed to the vendor. It is most generally used as an adjustment note used to rectify errors, returns, or overpayments related to a purchasing transaction. A `VendorCredit` can be applied to *Accounts Payable* Invoices to decrease the overall amount of the Invoice.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view a company's vendor credits.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

vendor.description: The vendor that owes the gift or refund.

currency.description:
The vendor credit's currency.

VendorCreditLine.description:
# The VendorCreditLine Object
### Description
The `VendorCreditLine` object is used to represent a vendor credit's line items.

### Usage Example
Fetch from the `GET VendorCredit` endpoint and view the vendor credit's line items.

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

net_amount.description: The full value of the credit.

company.description: The company the line belongs to.

exchange_rate.description: The vendor credit line item's exchange rate.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

detail.example: An unrecognized field, age, was passed in with request data.
